title: The Sunday Philosophy Club
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Then,  George  Maxtone requests the pleasure of the company of Ms Minty Auchterlonie at a Reception at the Lothian Gallery, at 6 p.m., Tuesday, 18th May; and Minty: Peter  and Jeremy,  Drinks in the Garden (weather permitting, probably not), Friday, 21st May, 6:30 p.m. And finally, Paul and Minty: Please come to our wedding reception at Prestonfield House  on Saturday,  15th May. Ceilidh, 8 p.m.

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Scones
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: He looked at the pictures. There had been a dinner at Prestonfield House, he read, and there had been hundreds of people there. He scrutinised the pictures and saw some faces he knew: Mr Charlie Maclean, in a kilt, talking to Mr Humphrey Holmes; Mr Roddy Martine talking to a lady in a white dress with a tartan shawl about her shoulders.

title: The World According to Bertie
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: could go to the Witchery or even Prestonfield House. But that, he thought, was not what Pat had in mind.
